Name: Battle: Practical Wargaming – Expanded Edition
Description: Charlie Murray Grant is the third generation, son of Charles Stewart, and he too has inherited a passion for the wargame hobby. Charlie, with his own 20mm World War Two armies, has developed his late grandfather's rules, added to them and provided a play sheet and instructions for refighting one of the original scenarios. In addition Charlie has added six chapters which were not in the original publication but which appeared in the Mecanno Magazine. In his own words "Battle has stood the test of time and with new content and play sheets it provides an excellent set of rules for up to company level actions".

Name: Lifewrecker
Description:
Party game for 3-4 players or teams.

On Kickstarter May 5, 2020:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/3inchhighgames/lifewrecker

Object of the game is to lose health, wealth, and social status on the way to rock bottom.

Players answer questions of how they would handle a scenario.  Answers result in penalties (which in this game are a good thing) and advance tokens toward disgrace, destitution, and death.  Once a play or team achieves all three objectives, the game is over.

The game takes 20 to 40 minutes to play depending on the amount of team discussion.

—description form the designer

Name: Brigadier General: World War II Miniature Rules for the Solo-Wargamer
Description:
Brigadier General

An element based World War II miniatures solo wargame with a d6 based system, Regiment & Brigade level battles.
Think of yourself as a Colonel or Brigadier General and that your concern is not so much what individual weapons or tactics a unit has but what its function is within your command.

It is assumed that you are a solo wargamer and that most of the terms in our book will already be familiar to you. Our goal with Brigadier General was to provide a fun and simple game with the ability to cover battles both real and imagined from 1931 to 1958. This is not a complicated game to produce historical results, but rather a simple game with a World War II setting . Remember when reading as well playing our game, to look upon them from the viewpoint of a solo wargamer.

We do not define ground & time scales in our games, instead we opt for what feels right on the table. Brigadier General uses blocks of troops which we call elements vice individual soldiers. Normally elements of troops in Brigadier General equate to a military company or depending on the game/scenario sometimes a battalion. However they can be scaled to suit any battle. Given the constraints in game, each player force would approximate a brigade, combat command or regimental team, hence our game’s name.

—description from the publisher

Name: COMBAT: 1948 Arab-Israeli War
Description:
COMBAT: 1948 Arab-Israeli War

Wargame rules to create battles of the 1948 Arab-Israeli Wars in 15mm, based upon our Combat WWII game system. D6 based. IGOUGO turn sequence.

Includes:

     Tables of Equipment for both Arab & Israeli forces,
     Scenarios, 
     Army Lists for most Arab forces like the Arab Legion, Egypt, Jordan, as well as the Israeli forces.  
     Features like:
         Commandos, 
         Minefields, 
         Weather, 
         Flamethrowers, 
         Artillery. 
         Aircraft 
         and more...
    


—description from the publisher

Name: COMBAT: The American Civil War
Description:
COMBAT: the American Civil War

15mm miniature wargame rules for the U.S. Civil War.

Features: Command Phase, Field Hospitals, special abilities like Rebel Yell & special units like Spencer's Rifles.

Multiple figures per base.

D6 based system.

IGOUGO turn sequence.

—description from the publisher

Name: Adventures with Gun, Sabre & Horse
Description:
Adventures with Gun, Sabre & Horse allows you to wargame battles of the late 19th Century in 15mm.

This is the first set in the series and contains the basic core game rules as well as two army lists with sample armies.

The two army lists with the core rules are: 

     Zulu Impi & 
     British Colonial Army.  


Future expansions will include advance rules, more units, armies and equipment.

Multiple figures per base with a 40mm frontage. 
Point based & scenario gameplay. 
IGOUGO turn sequence.

This is an "Old School" type wargame with simple yet trusty d6 mechanics.

—description from the publisher

Name: Balance of Power
Description:
Balance of Power are a set of horse and musket rules that allow players to fight battles with multiple corps per side in a reasonable amount of time.


     Each turn is 15 minutes, 
     each infantry unit approx 1000 men, 
     each cavalry unit approx 500 and 
     each artillery unit 12 guns. 


The rules emphasise easy to play game mechanics at the unit level so that a large number of units can be fielded.

Corps and army level morale as well as command and control rules mean that players are concentrating on what their major formations are doing as opposed to the finer details of what each individual unit is up to. Units themselves are defined by their troop quality giving them a ‘combat value’ that is used to calculate the effects of their fire, melee and how much punishment they can take before they break and flee.

Balance of Power allows players to fight battles from the French Revolution through to the 1870’s. They keep the detail and enjoyment of fighting with lots of units on table by making the actual game mechanics of combat and firing simple enough so that there is little or no need to refer to charts and tables. Players will find that historical tactics, bombardment, support, reserves and combined arms all go towards achieving victory.

The base game rules are quickly learned and a few players a side can cope with the largest battles. This allows battles to be fought through to a conclusion which makes them ideal for campaign games.

The aim of the rules is to give players time to develop plans, manoeuvre, conduct preparatory bombardments, all of which sees battles unfold in a historical manner.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rate of Fire: AFV Supplement
Description:
Rate of Fire AFV Supplement is an expansion for the Rate of Fire

This 48 page book covers tanks, soft vehicles, halftracks, SP guns, artillery, anti tank as well as infantry guns and weapons.

New rules cover:

     vehicle hit locations, 
     specific crew positions and survival roles, 
     special ammunition types, 
     HE and small arms against soft targets as well as 
     artillery against AFV’s.


Inside you will find over 500 separate vehicle data sets for

     German, 
     US, 
     British & Commonwealth, 
     Japanese, 
     Russian, 
     Polish and 
     Italian forces. 


Each vehicle has details of its main and secondary weapons, front and sides/rear armour factors for hull and turret, three speed brackets, crew numbers, positions and tasks as well as special notes and equipment.

This Rate of Fire AFV supplement has plenty of information that can be used with other WWII games but it is not a complete set of rules on its own. You’ll need a copy of the main Rate of Fire WWII Skirmish Rules to gain the most from this supplement.

Name: Imperium: Rome and its Enemies 107 BC to 476 AD
Description:
Imperium – Armies and Enemies of Imperial Rome is the second supplement for the Crusader wargames rules covering the armies and enemies of Imperial Rome. 
There are 13 lists enclosed, each with its own background information, army guidelines, allies, special rules and points values.


     Late Republican Rome 107 to 27 BC
     Early Imperial Rome 27 BC to 117 AD
     Middle Imperial Rome 117 to 285 AD
     Late Imperial Rome 285 to 378 AD
     Foederate Roman 382 to 476 AD
     The Barbarians 105 BC to 476 AD
     Spartacus’ Revolt 73 to 71 BC
     Jewish Revolt 69 to 73 AD
     Sarmatian Tribes 250 BC to 370 AD
     Parthia 238 BC to 225 AD
     Sassanid Persia 225 to 649 AD
     Palmyra 250 to 273 AD
     Huns 370 to 454 AD 


—description from the publisher

Name: The Macedonian and Punic Wars
Description:
The Macedonian and Punic Wars is the first army list book for the Crusader Wargames Rules.

You’ll need a copy of these rules to gain the most from this supplement but there is enough useful information (and some very nice photographs) to make this a worthwhile book in its own right.

There are seven major armies listed as well as details for allies and mercenaries that can supplement the forces of any of the major powers. As well as the army lists each nation has information on its history and major campaigns and advice on how to organise your forces and get the most from your troops on the tabletop.


     Carthaginian 275 - 146 BC
     Gallic 400 - 25 BC
     Hellenistic Greek 250 - 50 BC
     Macedonian Successor 320 - 146 BC
     Numidian 300 - 25 BC
     Roman 275 - 105 BC
     Spanish 200 - 20 BC


—description from the publisher
Families: History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

Name: Ramasse Trésor
Description:
A simple and fast family attention game for pirates!

The game consists of 50 thick round cards, with five elements drawn from the pirate universe (tricorn, long-view, treasure, pistol, bottle, etc.) on one side (yellow background) and one of these elements on the other side (white background). There is also a bomb card.

All players will play at the same time. The cards are spread out on the table facing yellow. At the start, each player takes a card, turns it and places it in front of him facing white. He must now find another card that shows on its yellow face the element discovered. He takes it, turns it on the white face and places it on its stack, revealing a new element to find and so on. When a player no longer has a chance to play, he grabs the bomb. All players check and look at who has picked up the most cards (including the bomb).

Name: Cat'astrophes: promo pack
Description:
8 New cards to add to the game.

Pack found in Plato magazine 122.

Name: Peer-to-Peer
Description:
Peer-to-Peer is a team deck-building game using the Tech Deck, a 21st century deck of playing cards. Players divide into two teams and share a play deck and group hand. Each individual player has asymmetric abilities on venture cards drawn from the deck that can develop over time. Teams compete to assist customers from the deck. Successfully assisted customers can be used to: 1. build their team's deck, 2. develop individual ventures, or 3. score. Rules for odd-number of players and solo-play are included.

The theme of the game is a 21st century modern setting, with an emphasis on peer-to-peer technologies that have become ubiquitous. Players on a team cooperate. Teams may choose to cooperate and negotiate, and assist customers (semi-cooperative) leading to lively group discussion and dynamics. The game uses simple math and card melds to determine who successfully assists customers.

There are three mutually-exclusive competing objectives: 1. to develop your team's deck, 2. to develop individual player's venture and 3. to score customers. Teams compete to assist customers and then the team has to chose how to use that customer card towards the three key objectives.

—description from the designer

Name: Owly Tribe: Promo tiles
Description:
New location tiles to add to the basic game.

Promo found in Plato magazine 122

Tile #1: Leave one of your warriors at this location for the next round

Tile #2: Copy the power of the location with the most warrior owls

Name: Repubblica Ribelle
Description:
"Repubblica Ribelle" ("Rebel Republic") is a partially collaborative wargame for 3-6 "rebel" commanders who must defend the free zone of the Republic of Montefiorino, in the heart of the Tuscan-Emilian Apennines, during the long months of guerrilla warfare that go from the summer of 1944 to spring of 1945, between Nazi-fascist attacks, difficult political balances and innumerable social difficulties.

At each round, a mission card is revealed, posing a problem related to the current situation that the players (representing various partisan factions) must solve by playing action cards (with military, political, and social values) and using pawns on a local territory map. If the problem is solved, the player who contributed the most gets the card, which will be worth one point in the final count, which will attribute the victory to the player who has been able to solve the greatest number of problems.

—user summary

Name: Quick 6 II Scenario Pack
Description: Second pack of six short Advanced Squad Leader tournament scenarios. These were designed for the 2019 West Coast Rumble.

Name: Rally Point Volume 17: Special Study II of the Korean War
Description: Contains ten ASL scenarios and a Communist People’s Volunteer Army (CPVA) player aid card. The scenarios are all for use with the ASL module 15: Forgotten War: Korea 1950-53

Name: POTUS
Description:
A family card game simulation of political life and elections in the USA since 1944. Play to become President Of The United States (POTUS).

Each player controls politicians who will run through the election process (primaries and presidential) in the hope to get elected President.

A President will then have to solve crisis, face Congress and maintain his approval by playing Executive cards during the course of his mandate.

Getting elected, playing or solving crisis (cards) will gain you Political Points, the winner being the first to reach 51 or the one who ends the agreed game duration with the highest score.

Players play with Politician cards, both historical and random, and have States cards where the can be elected.

They have access to Supports cards (to gain votes in Elections), Fundraising cards (to finance campaigns), Actions and Campaign cards to play more or less when they want (the "dirty tricks" department), and finallty Crisis cards to impeded the President's actions, opposed by Executive cards to solve the former.

Each turn see a card draft phase, a Congress phase where recruitments and other actions are taken, and an Election phase which allows to get candidates through to the supreme job.

Game has been divided into 3 equivalent periods of 6-7 turns to allow for shorter play. You can play the full campaign from 1944 onwards, till 2020...!

—description from the designer

Name: Apex Theropod Deck Building Game: Collected Edition
Description:
Apex is a deck-building game, played solo or with up to 3 friends (publisher recommends 2-4 players). You play as a prehistoric predator competing for territory and resources against other predators. Each playable species has a unique deck to master. Each deck has different strengths, weaknesses, and strategies—creating a varied and constantly evolving experience.

Your species must overcome a very brutal environment including harsh climate changes, disease, attacks from predators, grievous wounds, infections, and deadly prey. The game incorporates many dinosaurs that behave in their own distinct way. The goal of the game is to endure the environment, build up the population and evolve your species, and become the apex predator.

Base Game includes:

525 base cards + 20 Card Dividers
24" x 16" Hunting Grounds game board - folded
Six 16" x 9" Nesting Grounds mats - folded
Updated Rulebook 
Foam Blocks to protect cards and fill empty spaces

Includes 7 Playable Base Apex Decks:

Acrocanthosaurus
Carnotaurus
Giganotosaurus
Spinosaurus
Tyrannosaurus
Utahraptor
Velociraptor

Plus ALL Available Expansion Decks with Dividers:

Stomping Grounds [70 cards]
Suchomimus [70 cards]
Saurophaganax [70 cards]
Therizinosaurus [70 cards]
Megalodon [70 cards]
Exotic Predators - Quetzalcoatlus & Sarcosuchus [80 cards]
The Promethean Wars [40 cards]
The Stomping Dead [45 cards]

1st KS version Elite Hunter Tier 4 Exclusive Cards: Rexenator Boss, Minions, and Environment card.

These 1040 cards includes diverse animals to hunt, dangerous carnivores, opposing Boss cards with Minions (acts as artificial players for solo play), environmental effects, genetic evolution types, and grievous wound types.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hex-A-Spell
Description:
Hex-A-Spell is a hexagonal four-letter word game for your family and for school as a literacy/spelling game.

Connect two-letter bigram fragments to form four-letter words.

In this family word game, the goal is to make four-letter words from two-letter fragments (bigrams) and score top points. Compete with word fragments on hexagonal tiles. Form words in any direction using the most common bigrams in the English language.

—description from the designer

Name: Word Sleuths
Description:
Word Sleuths is a tabletop game of secret word deduction, 
for families and team building. Somewhat loosely described as multiplayer "Hangman", the game uses a proprietary deduction form to help players decode the words of their opponents.

Two to seven players attempt to guess each other's increasingly longer secret words in several rounds and accumulate the most points to win.

In this engaging and very vocal game, players have fun communicating and deciphering random letters into words.

The game can be played in any Roman-based language.

—description from the designer

Name: Pair Four
Description:
Pair Four is a tabletop word game where you make family-friendly four-letter words.

Link pairs of bigrams (two-letter fragments) one the sides of tiles into four-letter words.

—description from the designer

Name: Shifters Word Search
Description:
Shift letter tiles and find words in this dynamic word search game for one or more players aged five and up.

This lasercut wooden game comes with 

     50 A-Z letter tiles
     game board with 20 gates.


The goal is to shift letters to make and find words in any direction. For solitaire mode, try to beat your highest score shifting 25 letters.

—description from the designer

Name: Homeric Hack
Description:
Homeric Hack is designed to recreate in miniature individual duels, the epic battles of the Trojan War, from the battle of Thicket Ridge to the sack of the city itself and even the battles Aeneas fought in Italy. Only your imagination sets the parameters of the great engagements you can recreate. 
The system allows for heroic duels, large army engagements, naval engagements and sieges with the silver lining being a simple Divine Intervention system.

Homeric Hack Warfare in the Age of Heroes. explores in detail the military conflicts around the time of Homer (circa 800 B.C.). From the individual duels to the legendary battles of the Trojan War, Homeric Hack puts you in the midst of the military struggles immortalized by Homer, Creophylus of Samos, Panyassis of Halicarnassus, and others. Homeric Hack peels away the layers of myth formed over the centuries to reveal Greece's flesh and blood struggles as it blossomed into an ancient-world superpower.

Scales:

     1"= 50 feet
     1 turn = ~ 20 min
     1 mini = 5 to 200 men


Turn Sequence
Optional Challenge
Optional Divine Intervention

     Charge & Charge Response
     Shooting
     Morale Test
     Move Charges & Charges Responses
     Normal Movement Initiative
     Melee
     Rally 


—description from the publisher

Name: Machina Arcana (Second Edition): Premium Edition
Description: Outwardly identical to the retail second edition (see it for Contents, etc.), but this also contains the expansions Machina Arcana: Recurrence and Machina Arcana: Geometry of the Void.

Name: Launch Torpedoes
Description:
A solo board game where it's up to you to stop an enemy fleet from getting through!

In a bygone era, there's an enemy fleet that's hell bent on dominating an area a thousand miles square, and the only thing in its way is you and your torpedo boats and a scattering of a few water mines.

You must guess the enemy's every move and hope the mines you laid take a few of them out then pray that your torpedoes run hot and true to take out the rest!

Enemy movement is determined by the roll of a die, while you must anticipate the enemy's future moves before launching your torpedoes!

Launching from a distance is key to your boats' survival, while close contact will lead to your piecemeal destruction -- if you get in the enemy's way!

The enemy is only interested in getting past you, to reach the other side, so it will be your mission to get in their way -- hopefully, on your terms!

—description from the designer

Name: Dragon Bee
Description:
Game comes with:
Set of 55 animal cards
2 fifty sheet 4"x5.5" sketch pads
1 sixty second sand timer
4 3.5" pencils

Players will be able to play either in teams or individuals playing against each other. Cards have animals written on them and players will pull two cards and have a short amount of time to draw the two animals combined. In the team version, their teammates will have to guess the two animals to get a point. In the singles version, a pre-appointed judge will pick their favorite combination out of all of the players' drawings.

—description from the designer

Name: Bolsa de Valores
Description:
Bolsa de Valores is a Mexican board game where players must buy and sell shares of some of the companies that registered the greatest movement in the Mexican stock market many years ago.

It is played between two or more people, up to six. Its purpose is to make profits by buying shares at a low price and selling them at higher prices. Whoever owns the most money at the end of 90 minutes will win, either because they have it in cash or keep it represented in shares.

One of the players will be the broker and he/she may or may not take part in the game. In case of taking part in the game, he/she should be careful not to mix his/her money and his/her actions with those of the broker.

The broker will handle the money, sell and buy the shares, as well as monitor the progress of each game.

—user summary

Name: Vs System 2PCG: The X-Files Battles
Description: Latest "Big Issue" in the 2PCG Vs System featuring the X-Files theme.

Name: LVL3
Description:
LVL³ is a strategic board game which brings fun to everyone.

A fun, groundbreaking game, LVL³ forces you to think outside the box and devise a strategy
to conquer your opponents. Between 2 and 4 players can get in on each round of LVL³, the
brightly colored game that never stops moving and never stops reminding you to unleash your
inner competitor fully and unhesitatingly. Whatever your personal style is, your goal is the
same as everyone else's: to win. In LVL³, there is always one winner, one player who clearly
comes out on top.
Is it going to be you?

— description from the publisher

Name: Combat Command: Tripoli to Tobruk – Army Lists for Mediterranean Theatre September 1940 - December 1941
Description:
Tripoli to Tobruk is a Combat Command supplement covering the Mediterranean Theater of Operations September 1940 - December 1941.

Complete Battlegroup organizations for desert war forces of the British Commonwealth, Africa Corps and Italian forces.  Also included are Greek Battlegroups and German Gebrig and Fallschimajager Battlegroups covering the invasion of both Greece and Crete.

Besides the Battlegroups listings three scenarios drawn from the battles of Beda Fomm, Battleaxe and Crusader are included.

A copy of at least the Combat Command Basic game is required to use this supplement.

—description from the publisher

Name: Yankee Peas and Crackers! Wargame rules for the American War of Independence
Description:
Yankee Peas and Crackers!

These fast play rules for the American War of Independence are designed to accommodate any figure scale or basing convention, using the mechanism of `One Base Width`.

They feature the unique `Temporary Disorder` and `Permanent Loss` system whose simplicity lends itself to the crucial tactical depth required by this fascinating period of warfare.

The Order in which units fight is blended in with the usual considerations of quality and weapons along with key characteristics to bring the unique styles of fighting to life.

—description from the publisher

Name: Word Ringers
Description:
In Word Ringers, two to four players attempt to identify the most words. It's a strategic word search game. For 2-6 players, ages 6+.

Use rings to control critical locations, from which one or more words can be formed in any direction. Target as many words as possible in each round. Be the first player to reach a preset target score to win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Gott mit uns!: Fast play rules for the Thirty Years War and English Civil Wars
Description:
This is a simple and fast paced rule set to re-fight the battles of the Thirty Years and English Civil Wars with miniatures.

Gott mit uns!

They use an area system with the battlefield being divided into a grid of squares, this eliminates the need for measurement whilst creating the `Linie of Bataille` tactics of the period.

Any figure scale or basing system can be used with the basic game units representing Tercios, Infantry Brigades and Regiments of Horse.

The game is capable of handling the largest of the historical battles of the period in a matter of three or four hours.

—description from the publisher

Name: Krieg ohne Hass: WWII Division and Corps Level Wargame Rules
Description:
Krieg ohne Hass

Fast play wargame rules for Divisional and Corps level battles of the Second World War, using 15mm through to 2mm miniatures.

A grid based battlefield regulates all firing and movement eliminating any micro-measurement. No record keeping is required.

Vehicle scale is one base of miniatures to about 25 vehicles or about 250 men, with a grid square being one square mile. Command and control is central to the system without being complicated but having a significant impact upon operations.

A Divisional game can easily be fought through in three hours.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kalt Krieg ohne Hass: Cold War Brigade Level Fast Play Wargame Rules
Description:
Kalt Krieg ohne Hass

Fast play wargame rules for Brigade/Regimental level battles of the Cold War era, using 15mm through to 2mm miniatures.

A grid based battlefield regulates all firing and movement eliminating any micro-measurement. No record keeping is required.

Vehicle scale is one base of miniatures to about 10 vehicles or about 100 men, with a grid square being one square kilometre.

Command and control is central to the system without being complicated but having a significant impact upon operations. Included are special rules for air support, minefields, counter battery fire, Electronic warfare and chemical warfare.

A Brigade level game can easily be fought through in three hours.

—description from the publisher

Name: Beast  of Gévaudan
Description:
A Board Game of Influence, Mystery and Terror!

What follows is based on true historical events: Something monstrous stalks the French countryside of Gévaudan. A terrible beast is slaying scores of innocents, and particularly relishes in targeting young women and children. On New Year’s Eve, 1764, the Bishop of Mende proclaims the Beast a scourge sent by God to punish the people for their wicked ways. The people are commanded
to pray and repent, but this only serves to increase terror across the region and stoke the flames of superstition.  and organize an effective response to the situation. The story of The Beast is immediately spun into one of the first sensationalized and most influential media crazes. Captivating imaginations across France, Europe and beyond, the rising number of “unnatural deaths” increases the demand for publications such as the Courrier d’Avignon. All the while the beast remains unchecked.

Players enter the scene in January 1765, where they take on the role of hunters in pursuit of the Beast. Some have come for holy reasons, believing they combat the Devil’s manifestations on Earth. Others are driven by altruistic motives, hoping to save more innocents from being slaughtered by the menace. There are
those with less honorable reasons too, obsessed with seeking fame and fortune in slaying the Beast. And a diabolical few have more sinister motives, hoping to use the events as a smokescreen for their own personal vendettas and dark deeds. Veteran hunters also flock to the area just for sport, as this is a hunt for the ages! If they hope to succeed, players will need to curry favor with one of the four estates, through whose generosity they will gain superiority on the hunt. And with luck on their side, they might finally bring an end to The Beast of Gévaudan’s reign of terror!

The game themes  and mechanics revolve  around the following:

the Mystery of the Beast: A Novel Mechanic where the Nature of the Beast can be one of 24 options, which players try to discover during the game to prepare for the Final Hunt!

Spinning Narratives: Dealing with the Four Estates and secret patrons to spin the public opinion of what the Nature of the Beast is… and gain Influence above your rivals!

Deception and Secret Agendas: There are numerous ways to gain the most Influence and win the game… tactics and strategy are key to being triumphant!

Psychological Trauma and Animal Companions: The use of Fear and Trauma mechanics to help players also appreciate the terror people faced in those dark times… and that one’s faithful hound or trusty steed was all the treatment that existed back then!

—description from the designer

Name: Stackers Word Game
Description:
Stackers is a three dimensional word game where you stack letter  fragments into words.

This lasercut wooden game comes with a set of 170 tiles comprising one-, two- and three-letter word fragments along with a 5x5 stacking grid. These bigrams and trigrams are the most common in the English language.

The game plays like 3D Scrabble but with word fragments.

—description from the designer

Name: Minions' Revolution
Description:
Minions' Revolution is a mini board game for 1 to 6 players.

It contains a single rules page, three random tables and a print 'n play sheet. Each table contains 6 to 12 covering room's randomizer, treasure and events. The game is very easy to learn and each game lasts less than ten minutes.

Minions' Revolution can be played solo using an AI system to manage other monsters trying to take control of the dungeon.

The game system itself is single d6 based. Each monster is unique and pre-generated. Each monster has 3 characteristics: fight, run and health. It is an ideal system for players who like to change character at every game.

Actions are quickly resolved. The game system works on the principle of save rolls. Miss the roll and lose one health point.
The rules are certainly not perfect. When in doubt, write to me (or find out who is right in arm wrestling).

—description from the designer

Name: Eile mit Weile
Description:
The players represent a pedestrian (yellow), a coachman (green), a bicyclist (blue) and a motorist (red) with a separate track on the gameboard. Movement is determined by a die. On sone spaces traffic situations hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach his destination wins the game.

This game was published between 1927 and 1934 as indicated by the featured traffic signs.

—user summary

Name: Monkeys On Your Back
Description:
Monkeys On Your Back is a card game for the whole family. Defeat the Addicted Monkeys who will try to make you fall into temptation, taking you down on a wrong path and ruining your healthy lifestyle. Get the monkey off your back, survive the temptation and let your opponent fall victim to it.

It requires 5 min to learn and a gameplay is about 5 to 25 min. There is a kid friendly Standard Edition and a NSFW Edition for the grown ups. With 1 deck you can play from 2 to 5 players, combine 2 decks (of whatever edition) to play up to 9!

A super portable party game that you can bring everywhere to play with your family, friends and colleagues.

—description from the designer

SETUP:
1- Remove all the ADDICTED MONKEY cards from the deck.
2- Shuffle the remaining cards and hand out 5 of them to each player.
3- Insert enough ADDICTED MONKEYs in the deck in order to be 1 less than the number of players.

GAME TURN:
1- Draw 1 card from the deck. You can't avoid drawing in any way.
2- Play all the cards that you want from your hand. Or don't play anything, this is ok too.
3- Once you finished all your actions, pass the turn.

There are 3 types of cards than you can draw:

1- ADDICTED MONKEY:
You start the game with 3 life points, that will remain untouched until you will have an ADDICTED MONKEY.
When you draw an ADDICTED MONKEY a countdown immediately starts; you will lose 1 life point at the end of each turn you take while this card is in your possession.
Put the ADDICTED MONKEY on the table on top of your life-counter card, so to show your remaining life points. 
When your life points reaches 0 you will be eliminated.

2- ACTION CARDS:
There are 8 different action cards, with these you can counter the addictions like passing the ADDICTED MONKEY to other players or relocating them in the deck.

3- FIGURE CARDS:
You can combine these cards to create powerful combos, together with double-faced action card RALLY-JOLLY.

HOW TO WIN:
You have to eliminate the other players and remain the last one to survive.

If you will fall for an addiction, you will lose.
If you not, you will be the winner.

GET THE MONKEY OFF YOUR BACK AND LET THIS GAME BE YOUR ONLY ADDICTION!

Name: Enchanters: East Quest
Description:
East Quest expansion takes the Enchanters to the war-torn eastern realms. Their denizens may look like they’re nice, but they are all out of mercy when it comes to conflict. Their fighting techniques and magic are much different from what you already know. How will you manage as a stranger in this strange land?

Meanwhile, the Enchanters guild expands offering quests to their members. Slay the dragon, reforge the ancient sword, or just work as an enforcer to gain crystals or glory. This module will give you new avenues to pursue and new areas to compete in each game.

-description by the publisher

Name: Lights, Camera, Action
Description:
Get everyone on set and get rolling with this fun family game for movie buffs! Lights, Camera, Action is the ultimate movie themed party game where players have to draw, hum, mime and describe their way to Hollywood stardom! The perfect game for film fans, Lights, Camera, Action puts your movie knowledge to the ultimate test. Players pick a card featuring a famous film, then roll the die to determine the challenge. Depending on the result of the die, players then have to either ask trivia, hum, draw, mime or describe the film to the other players. So maybe your movie trivia is pretty good, but what about your drawing or miming skills? Lights, Camera, Action comes packaged in a neat clapperboard style box and includes 50 question cards, a notepad, pencil, sand timer and custom die. A great game to enjoy with friends or family, Lights, Camera, Action is a fun, fast paced movie quiz game that gets a little more from its star performers!

—description from the publisher

1845 is an expert level Railroad building, train operation, and stock manipulation game set in France in the mid to late 1800’s. It combines several features seen in similar 18xx games, with several twists to those mechanics added in to produce a free flowing Robber Baron atmosphere. Players have a large bankroll to begin the game, and the money can flow fast to each player, but debts pile up rapidly making long-term survivability the main player challenge along with maximizing train routes. A full range of interesting private companies provides a lot of early game decisions that will shape each players expectations and optimal positions on the large map of France. Limited enhanced cities (Paris, Nice, and multiple B cities and off-board cities) still provide conflict among players for the best starting locations, especially combined with the bonuses provided from the various private companies.

—description from the designer

Name: Légion d'honneur: Wargame 1808-1813
Description:
Légion d'honneur is a Miniature Wargame Rule set specifically designed for 28mm

In the work since 2010, these rules allow you to play at the brigade level in 3 to 4 hrs, at the divisional level in 5 to 8 hrs and, for the most dedicated ones, also let you simulate battles between army corps.

The principle of these rules is to offer a fair balance between historicity and playability.

To achieve that goal a few principles have been adopted:


     Play during - what we think - is the most even historical period: 1808 to 1813
     Erase some of the preconceived ideas of wargamers, such as line of fire/sight, English only in defense... to that goal historical researches were done using at least 2 different sources to make it in the rules. 
     Stop with the idea that a battle is won by the number of minis removed from the tabletop.
     Take into account formations actually used in that time period.  
     Take into account fatigue and the psychological overwhelming of the troops.



It may seem an ambitious project but that is what is on offer, including the fun factor.

LH is easy to get into, offer multiple opportunities to simulate battles, and under certain circumstances allow players to be in complex and challenging situations without being a pain.
    
—user summary

Name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – UFAG C.I
Description:
The UFAG C.I was a two–seat biplane that served the Austrian Air Service in many roles. First released in April 1918 and intended to update or replace earlier observation airplanes, its excellent speed and handling saw the UFAG C.I used for everything from escorting observation airplanes to ground attack to light bombing. The fastest two-seater produced by the Central Powers, its Hungarian manufacturer could not keep up with demands and only about 170 had been delivered when the war ended.

UFAG C.I (161–37)
In an attempt to improve UFAG’s firepower against enemy fighters, a second forward–firing machine gun was experimentally added to this airplane. This model has special cards to reflect the upgrade.

UFAG C.I (Flik 62/S)
Flik 62 was originally a divisional observation unit, formed in Trentino, Italy. It was turned into a ground attack unit, and renamed Flik 62/S, when it was equipped with the UFAG C.I.

UFAG C.I (161–138)
As a high–performing 2–seater, available in limited numbers, the UFAG C.I was often reserved for the best available crews. This model has special cards to reflect that.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

—description from the publisher

Name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Breguet BR.14
Description:
The Breguet 14 was one of the best all–round Allied two–seaters of the war, produced in large quantities for both recon and light bombing. Constructed largely of duraluminum and welded steel tubing, the airplane was light, sturdy, and very fast, with many features that were revolutionary for the day. It was the most common French two–seater in 1918 and was also used by USA and Belgium. This aircraft was widely used for both day and night bombing in the last year of the war. About 8000 were built before the war ended.

Breguet BR.14 B2 (Escadrille Br 111)
Breguet 14s were assigned to Escadrille 111 in October 1917. During the war, the unit scored 15 victories. This model includes cards for optional armament and crew skills.

Breguet BR.14 B2 (Audinot/Hellouin De Cénival)
Audinot and Hellouin de Cénival flew several bombing missions of Escadrille BR 127 from November 1917. They were shot down by enemy fighters during a daring mission, on March 28, 1918.

Breguet BR.14 A2 (Stanley/Folger)
Gilbert Stanley and H.T. Folger belonged to the 96th Squadron, that operated from June 12, 1918 to the end of the war engaging in daring bombing missions across the front.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

—description from the publisher

Name: There Are Your Guns! Warfare in the Age of Steam 1816-1897
Description:
There Are Your Guns! Warfare in the Age of Steam 1816-1897

is a set of tactical miniatures rule focusing on the Wars in Europe in the 19th century, using 25mm (but other scales can be used). 
Rule system is adapted from General de Brigade

Scale:
1 mini = 20 men
1” = 50 Yards
1 turn = variable

—user summary

Name: Star Trek: Customizable Card Game – Q-Continuum
Description:
Expansion to the base set that is based around the mischief of Q, this set included two Side Decks, extra stacks of cards from which you could draw under certain circumstances (This became a predecessor to downloading and was the first time you could exercise any control over what you would draw); and introduced several new card-types:  'Q-related' Events, Interrupts and Dilemmas. 
QC was released in 15-card expansion packs and the set included 121 cards.

Name: Warbands & Warfare
Description:
This is a low maintenance wargame. All you need is one to two D20s per player, a pencil, and the player sheet in the back of the PDF. Miniatures are strongly encouraged, but are not required.

Players assemble teams from a list of 27 historical warriors. Players take turns attacking their opponent, and their opponent rolls for defense.  Each turn is split into a ranged round and a melee round.  Each warrior has certain stats and advantages that players will have to utilize to overcome their opponent.

The players can choose from the following soldiers to put in their warband:

Apache, Assyrian, Aztec Jaguar, Centurion, Commander, Crusader, Diplomat, Gaul Warrior, Israelite Slinger, Janissary Turk, Knight, Longbowman, Maori Warrior, Mongol, Musketeer, Ninja, Persian Immortal, Pirate, Roman Legionary, Samurai, Scottish Highlander, Shaolin Warrior, Spartan Hoplite, Templar, Varangian Guard, Viking Berserker, and Zulu Warrior.

—description from the publisher

Name: Logisztori: Reformáció
Description:
Logisztori: Reformáció is an investigative game in which the referee tells an interestingly worded short start-up story and then asks a question that the group will collectively find the right answer with barkochba questions. Players have to work with each other based on their own knowledge and input. As well as bringing the events and spirit of the Reformation closer to the body and bringing it to life, the game provides an excellent team building and community experience, and can therefore be an excellent tool for communication and networking.

The cards contain information on one side of the question and the question itself, and the answer on the other side, with details of the sources. The cards also indicate the degree of difficulty of the question, with three grades to distinguish between the more well-known, the more difficult, and the abstract. Logistore can be played in pairs or groups, with a trained referee moderator in the group. We recommend it from the age of fourteen, especially in youth and adult groups.

—description from the publisher

Name: Beer & Pretzels Game: WWII Micro Armour
Description:
Beer & Pretzels Game - WWII Micro Armour

A great way to test the rules and get a feeling for them before buying the full rulebook.

Tank rules organized in such a way that players can learn how to play WWII Micro Armour: The Game. Once acquainted with the mechanisms of the game, players will be ready to use all the elements of WWII combined arms warfare found in the full rule set.
The most important is, for everybody to have a good time !

Sequence of Play:

     Initiative Phase
     Posture Determination Phase
     Joint Fire Phase
     Joint Movement Phase
     Marker Removal Phase


—User description from the book

Name: Beer & Pretzels Game: Modern Micro Armour
Description:
Beer & Pretzels Game - Modern Micro Armour

A great way to test the rules and get a feeling for them before buying the full rulebook.

Tank rules organized in such a way that players can learn how to play Modern Micro Armour: The Game. Once acquainted with the mechanisms of the game, players will be ready to use all the elements of WWII combined arms warfare found in the full rule set.
The most important is, for everybody to have a good time !

Sequence of Play:

     Initiative Phase
     First Joint Fire Phase
     Second Joint Fire Phase
     Joint Movement Phase
     Marker Removal Phase


—user summary

Name: Ecologic
Description:
In Ecologic, you run an extractive company, and you need to earn a profit from extracting minerals and oil – that’s business! But it is obvious that all big factories are harmful for natural environment. So, you should manage your income wisely: part of the money should be used to protect and restore the environment. Can you have a successful business and be a sustainable user of natural resources? And what is more important – money or environment? For different players the answer to the question will be different.

Ecologic will help you model various development scenarios where you must balance environmental and economic concerns – the key factors of development. The game has a “cumulative effect”: after playing it several times you will start understanding how to achieve sustainable and balanced development. Later you will learn to see several moves ahead and think strategically.

Each player (or team) runs a mining company, and the more oil pumps and mineral mines they have on the board, the higher their income. However, every Oil and Mineral Refinery damages the environment and reduces player's Enviro total. There are two indicators in the game: Profits as abstract money and Enviros as the environmental well-being estimation. In Ecologic the ratio and balance between these strongly influences the final score. The more balanced the two indicators are by the end of the game, the higher the victory score.

GAME MECHANICS

     The game consists of turns; each turn has four consequent phases: Event, Action, Environment, Income. 
     Random Events add unpredictability to the game with each turn.
     All purchases are done via bidding on an auction. The highest bidder gets the goods - just like in real life business!
     Tally up your Profit and Enviro balance every turn, and avoid having to shut down your refineries.

Name: How to Host a Dungeon (2nd Edition)
Description:
How to Host a Dungeon is a solo game where you create a dungeon while following it through its history by creating a map. This is a tabletop game, using pen and paper. When you play How to Host a Dungeon, you will create a unique dungeon by randomly generating features and resources like underground rivers, valuable ores, and mysterious caverns. Your world will be shaped by civilizations, settlements, and monsters, as they dig dungeons, expand their lairs, gather treasure, and fight for survival. As you play, you will make choices for the people and monster who live in your dungeon, ending up with a unique map and history.

The second edition of the game includes expanded content: a more sophisticated setup for the world, more civilizations, and a much larger variety of monsters. It also includes some rules improvements to make play simpler and more streamlined.

—description from the publisher

Name: Command Combat: Civil War 1862
Description:
Command Combat: Civil War 1862 is an expansion to Command Combat: Civil War - 1861.  Be sure to get that book before you get this one.

The war between the states is now in its second year, and neither side shows any sign of giving up.  In fact, the battles are becoming some of the most fiercely fought in history.  Families are split, brother fights brother in this bloody conflict, with more American casualties than all other wars combined.

In Command Combat: Civil War, you take the role of a real historical general leading his forces into battle.  Play as the stoic Grant, the flamboyant JEB Stuart, the cautious, yet beloved George McClellan, or even the marble man himself, Robert E. Lee.  There are many generals and specialized units from which to choose.

This first expansion in the Command Combat: Civil War series introduces generals, units, and scenarios for 1862, as well as expanded rules for forts, siege weapons, and the navy.
Just like in the core rulebook, every unit has a points value for creating your own army.  New specialty units include the Louisiana Tigers, the Iron Brigade, and the Orphan Brigade, as well as many others. 
Many generals who were in the core rules are expanded in this book, reflecting their changing styles of command as they rose up the ranks.  New generals who made their appearance on the war’s stage in 1862 also appear for the first time in these pages.  
Historic scenarios come pre-made with their original army lists.
Included in this book are Shiloh, Pea Ridge, Fort Donelson, Second Bull Run, Perryville, and Seven Pines.

Combine your army in lists from the core rulebook or any other expansion with armies you build from this book, and siege weapons such as heavy cannon, gunboats, signal towers and the balloon corps, or protect them inside specialized fortifications meant to hold off enemies for extended periods of time. Then fight it out with your friends using the unique and easy Command Combat game system.

Put on the general’s uniform and lead your men to victory in the most dynamic struggle in American history!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Command Combat Civil War (Bandwagon Games)

Name: Command Combat: Civil War 1863
Description:
Command Combat: Civil War 1863 is an expansion to Command Combat: Civil War 1861---.  Be sure to get that book before you get this one.

The war between the states is now in its third year, and the battles are getting larger and more fierce.  Both sides are desperate to win, and the climactic struggles are upon the men fighting.  Families are split, brother fights brother in this bloody conflict, with more American casualties than all other wars combined.

This second expansion in the Command Combat: Civil War series introduces generals, units, and scenarios for 1863, as well as expanded rules for larger armies and specialized regiments.  Just like in the core rulebook, every unit has a points value for creating your own army.  New specialty units include the 20th Maine, the 4th Texas, the 54th Massachusetts, the Oversized Regiment, the Washington Artillery, and many others. Some generals who were in the core rules and other expansions return with new features in this book, reflecting their changing styles of command as they rose up the ranks.  New generals who made their appearance on the war’s stage in 1863 also appear for the first time in these pages, as well as the rank of army generals to lead multiple corps into battle.

Historic scenarios come pre-made with their original army lists.
Included in this book are Gettysburg, Champion Hill, and Chickamauga.

Combine your army in lists from the core rulebook or any other expansion with armies you build from this book.  Then fight it out with your friends using the unique and easy Command Combat game system.

Put on the general’s uniform and lead your men to victory in the most dynamic struggle in American history!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Command Combat Civil War (Bandwagon Games)

Name: Command Combat: Civil War 1864
Description:
Command Combat: Civil War 1864 is an expansion to Command Combat: Civil War 1861.  Be sure to get that book before you get this one.

The war between the states is now in its fourth and final year, and everything is coming to a dramatic climax. The goals for both sides have become clear, and large armies are maneuvering into position for the final blow to their enemies.

In Command Combat: Civil War, you take the role of a real historical general leading his forces into battle. Play as the stoic Ulysses S. Grant, the legendary Robert E. Lee, the animated and passionate William T. Sherman, the hesitant but beloved Joe Johnston, or one of many other famous and colorful generals from the Civil War.

This third expansion in the Command Combat: Civil War series introduces generals and units,from 1864. These reflect the growing industrial strength of the Union and the determined defensive works of the Confederacy. The North gets access to weapons such as repeating rifles and train artillery while the South gets special rules and generals that increase their defensive capabilities.

This expansion also includes rules for playing campaign games where players maneuver their armies over vast distances and fight battles whose results affect the entire region, and carry over from one fight to the next. Create your own campaign using the rules, or use one of these historical ones included in the book: The Red River, Overland, and Atlanta campaigns.

Combine your army in lists from the core rulebook or any other expansion with armies you build from this book. Then fight it out with your friends using the unique and easy Command Combat game system. Put on the general’s uniform and lead your men to victory in the most dynamic struggle in American history!

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Command Combat Civil War (Bandwagon Games)

Name: Incredible Courage 1809, Alt-Eglofsheim
Description:
This battle deals with the situation after the Battle of Eckmuhl and the French pursuit of the Austrians.  General Nansouty with 3 cavalry divisions takes on a significantly smaller Austrian cavalry rearguard attempting to keep the French away from the Austrian main body, giving them time to get away.  There is only cavalry and a handful of artillery batteries in this fight.  It is a wild set of charges and counter-charges, with some intermittent artillery fire, spaced into a couple hours.  So the battle is short and easily played in an afternoon.  Counter density is low and there is some room for maneuver.  Both sides have a chance to win this event.  The more time the Austrians give the main body to escape the better the chance of winning.

Key Features                                                                     

        (4) 11" x 17" game maps of the Alt-Eglofsheim area
        Approximately 600 Die Cut Unit Counters and Markers
        (2) Full Color Order of Battle Charts
        Numerous charts and tables
        (2) Scenarios that allow play on smaller parts of the battle or the entire affair
        Variable combat strengths
        Reduction by Levels of Order
        Cavalry units at the squadron level and artillery at the section level
        Regimental level cavalry units
        Highly detailed without overbearing rules
        Excellent Solitaire Play


—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Incredible Courage 1805, Gunzburg
Description:
This battle deals with the situation at the start of the Battle for Ulm and the French cutting off of the Austrians.  General Mahler of Marshall Ney's VI Corps is ordered to the south bank of the Danube.  The general is faced by Austrians under the command of Baron D'Aspre who are positioned on the opposite bank of the Danube and are well supported.  Mahler splits his force into three groups and attempts to take the three bridges in the area.  His main force has no success in getting across the Danube in the center of his line, but they do capture the Baron and put his force into the dark with lesser leadership.  Meanwhile, a bit further north, one French regiment manages to cross the Danube and proceeds to overwhelm a strong Austrin force guarding the crossing.  Mahler then orders his remaining regiments to maneuver to the successful crossing site and together Mahler's divisions defeats the Austrians.

Key Features:                                                                  

    (8) 11" x 17" game maps of the Gunzburg area
    (1) Full Color Order of Battle Charts
    Approximately 500 Die Cut Unit Counters and Markers
    (4) Scenarios that allow play on smaller parts of the battle or the entire affair
    Numerous charts and tables
    Variable combat strengths
    Reduction by Levels of Order
    Infantry units at company level, Cavalry units at the squadron level, and artillery at the section level
    Battalion level infantry, and Regimental level cavalry units
    Highly detailed without overbearing rules
    Excellent Solitaire Play


—description from the publisher

Name: Incredible Courage 1805, Wertingen
Description:
This battle is the First Contact of the Ulm campaign.  It set the tone for the entire campaign and gave the French an immense boost of confidence.  Napoleon has ordered his Advance Guard, consisting of part of Murat's Reserve Cavalry and Lannes' Vth Corps, to begin the swing around to the south and east of Ulm, in order to cut off Mack from Vienna.  Mack, being a bit in the dark about the French maneuvers, sent a force under Baron Auffenberg, to determine where the French were.  The Baron's force marched into a very bad situation where his troops, mostly grenadiers, was seriously outnumbered.  A member of the French Impaerial Staff, General Kellerman, happened to be forward with the troops.  He saw a small group of Austrians in the town of Hohenreichen and ordered the Dragoons he was with the dismount and clear out the Austrians.  It was a small affair, but one that showcased the Dragoons ability to fight as infantry.  The Dragoons success in pushing out the small Austrian force led to the scenarios that are included in the game.  In the end the Austrian force was eliminated as a threat to Napoleons plan to surround and capture Mack's force.

Key Features:                                                                   

      (4) 11" x 17" game maps of the Wertingen area
      Approximately 800 Die Cut Unit Counters and Markers
      (2) Scenarios that portray the Main Battle starting around noon, and the Austrian movement back to the main position.
        Full Color Order of Battle Charts
        Numerous charts and tables
        Variable combat strengths
        Reduction by Levels of Order
        Infantry units at company level, Cavalry units at the squadron level, and artillery at the section level
        Battalion level infantry, and Regimental level cavalry units
        Highly detailed without overbearing rules
        Excellent Solitaire Play


—description from the publisher

Name: Kingswood: Tantrum House Location Promo
Description:
Location promo for the Tantrum House Kickstarter campaign.

When a player activates this ability, they pick up all of their resources and toss them into the box lid. The outcome of what is refreshed and what is still exhausted will become your new resource mix. Take them out of the box and place back in front of your character in your player area.

This card was inspired by the table flipping contest events at the TantrumCon as well as the opening credits for Tantrum House videos.

Name: Spain In Flames: Manual de Referencia y Organización Para Wargames De La Guerra Civil (1936-1939)
Description:
Spain in Flames is back!!!

In the 93-page book you will find comprehensive and exhaustive rules and organisations to play Spanish Civil War wargames, with battalion, company and platoon level organisations, ranging from the Regular Republican, International Brigades, Legionarios, Requetes, Guardia de Asalto, Guardia Civil, … and much more, plus data of vehicles and equipment…

Spain in Flames, also includes a painting guide for armies and vehicles of the Spanish Civil War.

A must-have for any wargamer interested in the Civil War.  At the moment, only the Spanish language version is available, but the visual layout alone will be useful for non Spanish speakers.

—description from the publisher at Wargame vault

Name: Aether
Description:
Levitatores is a game in which we assume the role of Masters of different Orders of Telekinesis, being: as Maidens of Water, as Druids of the Moon, Electrostatics and Air Priests.
Each Order contains special powers that aid in the manipulation of the Ruins of Dracor, which holds the Sacred Artifacts of nature.
In the game, we must manage, in the best possible way, the energies and stability required to levitate one of the six sacred stones to fulfill the challenges.
Each challenge is an engaging and challenging puzzle that contains a pattern shown as exact positions where each stone should be.
With each round, we evolve in our special abilities, developing new possibilities for levitating stones.
The Master who will be most successful in the challenges will be the new Guardian of the Sacred Artifacts, ensuring the balance between nature and life.

—description from the publisher

Name: Scum of the Earth: Black Powder gaming for the rest of us
Description:
Scum of the Earth. Black Powder gaming for the rest of us.

"Sire, the reinforcements have arrived on our left flank!"

"Excellent Windsor, let's give these French degenerates what for"

"But Sire, their uniforms... "

"What about their uniforms?"

"They look... well Sire, I swear they look like Austrians"

"By God man, if they are shooting at the French, what does it matter what they look like?"

We all have a shelf full of dusty miniatures: Those 8 grenadiers you bought because you were going to build an army, 20 Austrians and a few Seven Years War cavalry you never got around to using.

Scum of the Earth is a game intended to help get those figures off the dusty shelf and on to your table.

The goal is to remove as many barriers as possible to play: We use small units (6 figures/stands for infantry), the game plays on a 2x2 foot table and require only a couple of dice to play.

Features include:


     Core game rules that can be explained in a couple of minutes.
     Character figures such as flag bearers and leaders are included.
     A Trait building block system letting you construct units that are colourful and interesting. Your French Hussars might be Arrogant and Stalwart while my British regulars are Veteran Scum.
     Campaign rules using a card system, letting you play a character-ful campaign without relying on maps.
     Rules for retaining your battle hardened veterans across multiple games.
     A quick scenario generator.
     Random terrain and battle complications.
     Notes, rules adjustments and traits to let you play the following conflicts:


English Civil War, Seven Years War, American Revolution, Napoleonic Wars, First Schlesvig War, Crimean War, American Civil War, Second Schlesvig War, Austro-Prussian War, Colonial battles, Franco-Prussian War, Spanish American War, Russo-Japanese War and 1914.

Each period is brought to life with a few rules to adjust the core game mechanics as well as colourful traits such as "Courtesy of Norway", "Rebel Yell" and "Every man a Marshal".


     * * * *


The goal of Scum of the Earth is not to provide an exacting simulation, it is to provide a flavourful microcosm of warfare in the black powder era (and just beyond).

Most importantly, it is about getting picking up a pack of figures that you like the looks of, painting them as you like them and getting them on the table.

—description from the publisher

Name: FiveCore Company Command People's Edition: Company level Warfare in the 20th Century
Description:
FiveCore Company Command

Use the fast-playing, easy to remember FiveCore mechanics to resolve company level world war 2 and modern engagements in less than two hours.

The game moves quickly and with an unpredictable turn sequence that keeps you on your toes. Morale is built right into the firing roll with no need to consult lists of modifiers.

The rules provide a quick scenario and army generator as well as rules for infantry, tanks, support weapons and helicopters.

1 stand equals 1 squad or vehicle. Typical game had 6-12 stands on each side.

—description from publisher

Name: It's a Wonderful World: Empire Cards Side C
Description:
Promotional pack of cards containing the Empire cards with a new C side for a more challenging game.

Contains Empire cards for Panafrican Union, Republic of Europe, Aztec Empire, Federation of Asia, and Noram States.

Originally included with the Heritage Edition, but can be had at conventions from Lucky Duck Games.

Name: Chevauchee: A Medieval Skirmish Wargame
Description:
Chevauchee. A Medieval Skirmish Wargame

Swords, mud and blood.

Medieval man to man fighting was brutal and unpleasant but there's no reason your game rules should be.

Chevauchee takes the familiar, fast-moving engine from FiveCore and adapts it to medieval skirmish warfare.

Features include:

     Warband level gameplay where you can get to know each member of your army.
     Simple D6-based combat mechanics that combine morale and injury into a single roll.
     Systems to build almost any medieval (or fantasy) weapon you can think of.
     Full detailed campaign rules letting you follow a warband across multiple encounters and random events. 
     Random character creation providing you with a strong roleplaying element.
     Character skills, letting each individual be a unique contributor to your noble crusade... or petty thievery.
     The "Fief" campaign, letting you run your own petty domain. Hope the peasants aren't too revolting!
     Written by the incredibly talented Tom Mecredy, utilizing the FiveCore skirmish rules as a base.


Chevauchee is suitable for games of 6-12 figures per side, using any individually based figures.

While utilizing the base FiveCore system, every mechanic has been tweaked to fit the subject matter.

Scenario generator and campaign rules are included. No need to buy extra books just to play a long adventure.

—description from the publisher

Name: Squad Hammer: Dirt simple war gaming for many settings...or all of them
Description:
What does the rubble of Stalingrad, Vietnam, the far future and sword wielding dinosaur hunters have in common?

You can play all of them (and more) using Squad-Hammer!

Aimed at friendly, casual games by people who are interested in easy rules, Squad-Hammer can be summarized on a single sheet of paper.

Inspired by systems such as "One hour wargames", "I ain't been shot mum" and "FUBAR", the rules use a simple universal combat system, relying on player judgement to set target numbers.

(Though don't fear, we do provide "canned" target numbers if you prefer to have the book do it)

The book includes a quick mission system (with victory points) and campaign rules, options for off-table support and a big section on creating your own units, from T-72 tanks to fire-breathing aliens.

We round things out with a points system to calculate the rough effectiveness of troops and of course the mandatory NWG optional rules chapter, letting you customize the game to your liking.


     * * * *


Squad-Hammer is a call-back to an older, more casual style of gaming: A game where having a fun battle takes precedent over aggressive competitiveness and where the rules support your model collection.

Standard units can be any size you like. The default is squads of 5-8 infantry models or single vehicles/monsters but nothing would stop you from playing with individual models (Man to Man) or using troop stands with multiple figures per stand).

Note that unlike some of our games, Squad-Hammer does NOT include explicit solo mechanics though due to the simplicity of the mechanics, it is very easy to play with one player controlling both sides.

—description from publisher

Name: Trench Hammer: A Mini Miniatures Game for WW1
Description:
The War to end all wars didn't end war... but with Trench Hammer you'll be able to play a game to completion in one sitting!

Trench Hammer is what we call a "Mini Miniatures Game" : A game that is playable with only a few pages of rules and with a small collection of figures.

Using the game engine of Squad Hammer, these rules are aimed at beer&pretzels war gaming.

Starting with a platoon each, once you have played a few times, you could easily field a full company each.

Rules included cover:

     Guidelines for simple war games campaigns.
     Tank rules.
     Details on organization for late-war German and British platoons.
     3 scenarios as well as a random objective table.
     Everything you need to play low-level infantry battles in under 40 pages. This includes options, advanced rules and just enough chrome to wet the appetite.


Playable both with individually based figures and figures organized in troop stands.

You can get into a new war gaming period without buying a ton of miniatures.

The rules are laid out to be screen and print friendly.

80's nostalgia look.

Compatible with the Squad Hammer generic war game rules and the Russian Civil War version.

—description from publisher

Name: October Hammer: A Mini Miniatures Game for the Russian Civil War
Description:
Reds, Whites, anarchists, nationalists, Freikorps, Polish army.

The Russian Civil War is a fascinating period to war game and with October Hammer you can do so easily, quickly and without a huge investment.

October Hammer is what we call a "Mini Miniatures Game": A game that is playable with simple rules, a small collection of figures and for a low price of entry.

Using the same game engine as Squad Hammer and Trench Hammer, the rules are aimed at Beer & Pretzels gaming but with plenty of chrome.

The core mechanics are simple and can be taught in minutes.

Games are intended to be short, allowing you to get a rematch the same evening, even with multiple participants.

Rules cover:

     Various troop types from machine guns to partisans to armored cars.
     Optional and advanced rules to customize your game.
     Campaign and scenario set up rules.
     Army lists for 15 different forces, allowing you to quickly generate a force through a combination of random roll and selection systems.


Playable with both individual figures and with figures organized on troop stands.

You can begin a new war gaming period without owning more than a few stands worth of troops.

The rules are laid out to be as screen and print friendly as possible.

80's nostalgia look.

—description from the publisher

Name: Winter Hammer: Easy Rules for the Soviet-Finnish War
Description:
Frozen forests, T26 tanks and bitter fighting. The Soviet-Finnish Winter War has it all and now you can delve into it without learning a 500 page rule book.

Winter-Hammer is based on the popular Squad-Hammer game engine and is aimed at beer&pretzels war gaming.

Players can pick up the mechanics quickly and with ease, while the rules offer the mechanics you need to set up pick-up battles and fight out a fun war games campaign.

All you need is some suitable figures in a scale you enjoy.

The typical game set up doesn't require more than 10-12 troop stands per player, meaning you can play without having to paint up hundreds of figures.

The only dice needed are simple D6's.

Troop stands can represent from squads to platoons depending on desired scale and based whichever way you prefer.

Games can be played to completion in an hour in many cases.

Compatible with the Squad Hammer generic war game rules and the Russian Civil War version.

—description from the publisher

Name: Trench Hammer: Expansion Pack
Description:
Out of the trenches and to the green fields beyond!

Well, if you are going to get that far, you'll need this expansion pack for the Trench Hammer miniatures rules.

Offering everything from 

     new and optional game rules, 
     random army generation (both quick and complex), 
     a handful of new unit types, 
     new ways to conduct assaults 
     and more... 


This offers a compendium of new ways to play your games.

The booklet is also compatible with October Hammer.

—description from publisher

Name: Hammer of Democracy: Friendly Battle Rules for the Second World War
Description:
So after much pain, sweat and toil, Hammer of Democracy is available.

If you aren’t familiar with our Hammer series of games, it’s a relatively rules-light game for low-level ww2 action, aiming to play very quickly and with minimal rules look-up.

A typical game ranges from a reinforced platoon up to a company or more and plays in a very small span of time, combining pretty simple mechanics with surprisingly deep tactical play.

The game is welcoming of open-ended play where target numbers are set by consensus or a GM, as well as offering a more traditional “fixed” approach with modifiers and tactical factors.

As always, we offer suggestions for campaign play, a scenario generator and a points system.

You also get profiles for the more common fighting vehicles and anti-tank guns of the war, complete with the formula to calculate your own points values if you need.

This also means if you disagree with our factors, you can adjust them as you see fit.

If you want to play a simple pick-up game, you can generate an overall battle situation and either roll up random forces to play with, bring an army built to a pre-determined points total or any other option you want to employ.

A key innovation of Hammer of Democracy is the Support system, tying in things like off-map fire and using weapons such as machine guns and anti-tank guns in a way that feels truly combined arms, while forcing hard choices on the player.

Playtesters have been pretty universally excited about this system and I think you’ll find it really cool.

Lastly of course we offer a tool box of rules for things like radio problems, fighting in the snow and dealing with civilians, as well as troop traits for commando’s, die-hards and even special hero characters if you like your gaming a bit more pulp.

Whether you are already a fan of games like Squad Hammer and Trench Hammer or brand new to the concept, I hope you’ll give us a chance to win you over.

The core mechanics are shared between Trench Hammer and Hammer of Democracy so that should give you a pretty good idea of what you are in for.

Basic factors

     All dice used are plain D6’s with most rolls made using 2D6.
     There are no ‘Bucket of dice’ mechanics in play.
     Turn sequence is IGOUGO with reaction options. 
     Game turns are very fast, most being resolved in 5 minutes or so.
     Basic elements are squads/sections of infantry or single vehicles.
     Infantry can be based on team stands or individually. 
     The rules are nominally intended for 15mm figures but has been tested with anything from 6mm to 1/72 scale.


—description from publisher

Name: Squad Hammer: Man to Man
Description:
Squad Hammer Man to Man is an expansion for the Squad Hammer rules focusing on adding a bit more character:

Namely to let you play games where the units are individual figures rather than squads of troops.

Within this supplement you will find:


    Advice and suggestions for handling single-figure units in conventional games, including combat and spotting rule adjustments and new rules for Officers (inspired by Trench Hammer).



    A collection of new options for games where every unit is a single figure, including new damage mechanics, tweaks to the combat systems and more cinematic action.



    Notes on melee-only characters.



    A new melee initiative system.



    Rules for Goons: Perfect for Imperial storm troopers, nazi thugs and other cannon fodder.



    A detailed injury table allowing characters to be stunned, knocked out or otherwise injured when they get shot.



    Detailed infiltration rules for stealth scenarios, adapted from FiveCore.



    A D20 table allowing you to add individual objectives to a character: Perfect for solo gamers and big club games alike.



    A system to gain experience, upgrade your heroes... and have them die horribly in battle.


Many of these options are also applicable to games of Trench Hammer, October Hammer or Winter Hammer especially those of you who are interested in something a bit more pulpy and cinematic.

—description from the publisher

Name: FiveCore: Field Guide – Options and Rules for All Fivecore Games
Description:
The FiveCore field guide contains expanded rules material suitable for all FiveCore games (the 2nd edition skirmish rules, Five Men in Normandy, Company Command and Brigade Commander.

Within this supplement you will find:

     A new dice-driven turn sequence.
     A points-based experience system for campaign play.
     Non-combat skills and advancement, as well as additional motivation and background generation for characters.
     15 new weapons, gadgets and gun mods for skirmish games.
     "Firing Skill". A new system to quantify individual firing ability.
     "Assault Skill". A new system to quantify close combat ability.
     Revised (and somewhat less deadly) assault rules.
     Unit Discipline. A new system to distinguish individual unit morale.
     Suggested fire, assault and discipline ratings for major 20th century conflicts.
     A more random reaction system.
     A more detailed system for determining vehicle and gun ratings.
     An expanded stealth system, with more options for both infiltrators and sentries. Well suited for commando raids.


—description from the publisher

Name: High Seas Fleet: The Great War at Sea – Data Annexes
Description:
The High Seas Fleet Data Annexes booklet provides the ship and aircraft data needed to play the High Seas Fleet Scenarios, as well as data for the major units and some “almost built” classes. 
The annexes cover the ships and aircraft of

     Austria-Hungary, 
     France, 
     Germany, 
     Great Britain, 
     Japan, 
     Russia, and 
     Turkey.



 This second edition of the Annexes has corrected and improved the data based on the many new information sources available since it was first published in 2001. It also takes advantage of the designers’ increased understanding of ship design, armor manufacture, explosives, and ballistics to create the most accurate information in existence about the naval weapons used in the Great War.

—description from the publisher

Name: High Seas Fleet: The Great War at Sea: August 1914 - November 1918
Description:
High Seas Fleet 2nd edition Scenario Booklet provides over forty scenarios for all the major WW I naval actions, which include the well-known big battles like Jutland (broken into three parts, as well as the complete engagement), Dogger Bank, and many smaller fights. 
The scenarios often include variants, covering historical “almosts” and “what ifs”.

This second edition takes advantage of the new scholarship and many information sources that have appeared since the first edition was published in 2001. This includes the massive amount of material associated with the centenary of WW I, and especially the Battle of Jutland, or Skaggeractschlacht, as the Germans call it.

Naval historian Nick Jellicoe, grandson of Admiral Sir John Jellicoe, has graciously written a foreword.

—description from the publisher

Name: Plunderbund: Promo Recruits
Description: Promotional pack of cards containing the recruits Closer and Fixer. The pack contains 3 cards of each type to be shuffled into the recruitment deck.

Name: Spirit Duels
Description:
Spirit Duels is a fast-paced card game of dice-driven combat. Lead a team of magical creatures known as Spirits into battle against your opponent! Command and evolve your Spirits to gain the advantage in combat and defeat your rivals!

—description from the publisher

Name: Evening Napoleon: The  Ultrafast Napoleonic Wargame Ruleset
Description:
Evening Napoleon is a light and ultrafast wargame system set in the Napoleonic Wars. 
With this game you can play the largest battles the period has to offer in a very short amount of time.
