This game comes with one scenario, and rules on how to create your own scenarios.

—description from the publisher

Name: Evening Napoleon: Expansion One – The Marengo Campaign
Description:
Evening Napoleon is a light and ultrafast wargame system set in the Napoleonic Wars. With this game you can play the largest battles the period has to offer in a very short amount of time.

This expansion includes a scenario for the entire Marengo Campaign of 1800.

—description from the publisher

Name: Space Maze
Description: Space Maze is a plastic rotating contraption containing two large mazes. Each player grabs a magnet and a magnetic wand and drops the magnet into the start position. At the same time the players race to move the magnet from the start of the maze to the finish. The first player to reach the end of the maze wins a point. The contraption is then rotated, which changes the configuration of the maze. The players then race again. The mazes can be altered 9 times and it is recommended in the rules that players play through 9 rounds, with the player winning the most races being the ultimate winner.

Name: Fighting Brothers: American Civil War Rules
Description:
Fighting Brothers - ACW rules

Based on the Veni Vici Vici, Best Allies 18th century land battles rules. These stand-alone rules cover land battles in the American Civil war.

The basic fighting unit is a regiment or a battery of artillery. These are grouped into brigades, with brigades grouped into divisions and for really large battles into corps.

Turns are performed by alternate activation of brigades, with the quality of the commanders determining how many actions a brigade can make.

Basic unit types are: infantry, cavalry, artillery and skirmishers with different quality/skill levels.

Points system for units and army lists for points based games.

The army lists can be used to convert historical orders of battle, into lists for games.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rival Restaurants: Back for Seconds
Description:
In the quest to be named "The Hippest Spot in Town," aspiring chefs and restaurateurs must do whatever it takes to be crowned "The Wiener!"

In Back for Seconds, Rival Restaurants's first ever expansion, players will enjoy 8 new chefs, 6 additional restaurants, and 9 brand-new action cards. However, the biggest addition to the Rival Restaurants universe is...the Event Deck.

The Event Deck features 15 Event Cards. Events are activated every other day and affect all players. Players see events one day in advance so that they can prepare and strategize accordingly. The Event Deck is sure to spice up the competition as players are forced to adapt their strategy on the fly.

—description from the publisher

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – Xi-class Light Shuttle Expansion Pack
Description:
The First Order's agents are scattered across the galaxy, from enclaves in the Unknown Regions to pockets of sympathizers within the New Republic. The Xi-class light shuttle is swift and lightly armed, suited to conveying First Order VIPs quickly but surreptitiously from base to base. It can also serve as a command craft, directing forces in raids before the attackers slip away into the depths of space once again.

Within this expansion, you’ll find a beautifully detailed Xi-class Light Shuttle miniature along with everything you need to launch it on your own secret mission, including a medium plastic base and two medium ship tokens. Four ship cards let you dispatch some of the First Order’s most elite agents to do your bidding while 14 upgrade cards let you assign additional crew members to the ship and outfit it with new technology.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – LAAT/i Gunship Expansion Pack
Description:
A durable, reliable workhorse capable of serving in a wide array of environments, the LAAT/i gunship is renowned for getting the job done. Whether making precision drops of clone troopers on contested worlds, supporting Republic formations with interlaced fire in atmospheric battles, or engaging starfighters in the depths of space, the LAAT/i can be outfitted for nearly any role or battlefield.

The LAAT/i Gunship Expansion Pack contains everything you need to add one of these sturdy ships to your Galactic Republic squadrons, including a finely detailed LAAT/i Gunship miniature, four ship cards, 14 upgrade cards, and two quick build cards to get your ship directly into the fight.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Star Wars: X-Wing (Second Edition) – HMP Droid Gunship Expansion Pack
Description:
A menacing silhouette slides overhead, repulsorlifts humming ominously and eyes glowing with malevolence. The HMP gunship's presence invokes fear thanks to predatory droid intelligence and an unpredictable capacity to strafe targets with devastating missile pods, bombs, and a wide-sweeping array of laser cannons.

The HMP Droid Gunship Expansion Pack unlocks new possibilities with a beautifully detailed HMP Droid Gunship miniature and six ship cards with their own programming and protocols for battle. Your droid gunship can be further modified to your exact specifications with eight upgrade cards, or you can follow the recommendations of three quick build cards to get your gunship into battle as quickly as possible.

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Star Wars X-Wing Miniatures Game

Name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – RAF R.E.8
Description:
The RAF R.E.8, introduced in early 1917, was the long–awaited replacement for the Be2 series of recon airplanes, offering greater speed and strength. Initial reactions were mixed, as the R.E.8 required more pilot attention than the Be2 and early accidents of spinning and stalls resulted. Once overcome, the airplane became the standard for British observation and light bombing, serving through the end of the war. It was nicknamed “Harry Tate,” after a cockney comedian, who pronounced his name “AIR–EE.”

RAF R.E.8 (30 Squadron)
30 Squadron, including the first Australian airmen, served entirely in the Middle East, even air dropping supplies to the besieged troops at Kut.

RAF R.E.8 (Marsh/MacKay Dempster)
52 Squadron was the first unit equipped with the R.E.8. It suffered heavy losses— among them Marsh and MacKay Dempster’s airplane — fighting in the German 1918 offensives.

RAF R.E.8 (59 Squadron)
59 Squadron went to France in February 1917 with a mix of veterans and rookies. The squadron suffered heavy losses during “Bloody April,” but served through the Armistice.

Name: Wings of Glory: World War 1 – Pfalz D.III
Description:
The Pfalz D.III began front–line service in August, 1917. Though its construction techniques gave it a light air frame, the Pfalz was known for being both sturdy and a little slow on the controls. Poor in climbing, it was an excellent diving airplane and popular to use for balloon attacks. The D.IIIa version solved many of the problems, with guns repositioned to assist pilot in clearing weapons of jams, and made up the majority of the 1100 airplanes built by war’s end, with most of them flown by Bavarian Jastas.

Pfalz D.IIIa (Berthold)
Rudolf Berthold (44 victories) flew missions from the very beginning of the war until nearly the end, even after having suffered serious injuries in addition to having lost the use of his right arm.

Pfalz D.IIIa (Holtzem)
Max Holtzem was a German test pilot, flight instructor and member of a Bavarian pursuit squadron. He received the Iron Cross 2nd Class and the Bavarian Military Merit Order with Swords.

Pfalz D.III (Voss)
Werner Voss was a very remarkable pilot that deserved many awards for his numerous enemies shot down in combat (48 victories), and a good friend of Manfred Von Richtofen.

Each WW1 Wings of Glory® Airplane Pack is a ready–to–play model, painted and assembled, 100% compatible with any other WW1 Wings of Glory game product.

Name: Medieval Mayhem: The Card Game
Description:
Welcome to the days of old, when knights were bold!

Medieval Mayhem is a family-friendly and simple but addictive card game – a crazy mash of humor, kings, strategy, caricatures, wizards, bluffing, puns, randomness and other nonsense...

Split your hand of ten debatably brave characters into five powerful armies and let them loose on your friends!! Before the battle starts, you will also have a betting round: the perfect opportunity to bluff and deceive the other players.

Here is the recipe for creating Medieval Mayhem: mix Exploding Kittens and Poker, add Hugo's crazy cartoons and Andreea's charming watercolors, sprinkle a Medieval theme (and puns!) onto it, balance the flavors so that it can be enjoyed by kids and grown-ups and by casual and serious players alike, et voila - you now have Medieval Mayhem!!

— description from the publisher

Name: 18Iran
Description:
18Iran is an 18xx genre style game set in the early days of the Iranian railway expansion.

It is a small, short playing 18xx that features town growth and a unique 2 city railway that runs completely separately to the main board but requires regular maintenance costs.

Among other features is a bonus for delivering to certain cities and a unique hex tile for bypassing the main city.

The privates are a mix of delivery bonuses and revenue only

all privates companies and railroads are historically accurate as is the map/route building aspect.

Name: Divine Corruption
Description:
In Divine Corruption: Rebirth, you play as a human who’s starting their second and final life in Aurae, the kingdom and paradise reserved for celestial beings. Selected by those heavenly rulers to serve as a lowly slave, it’s up to you to do everything you can to prove your value to your masters, so that you too can join the celestial caste. But remember that there are only two ways a slave’s life can end: in coronation among the celestials or in death.

In this semi-cooperative game, every outcome is possible. You can all be victorious and live happily among celestials or you can all finish on the scaffold. Only you can decide your path, will you cooperate with your peers or will you try to be the only one to live?

Every move, every action, every card you play have consequences. Help a fellow comrade accomplish a mission and he can help you achieve your goal but, take the renown of a more ambitious fellow player and see how fast revenge will come.

Each turn, the active player chooses the mission he wants to do. He can either do it alone if he has enough profession or ask another player and share credits. By doing a mission you gain renown but the more you are, the less you gain.

Then, any player can play cards from their hands. They can either be good with you and help you out or they can try to steal your points or your own cards.

People will do missions and amass points until one if them gets 75 points. At this point you have only a few turn before the game ends and all of those with 75 will have won, all the other will lose their heads and die for good this time.

—description from the publisher

Name: Vida de Formiga
Description:
In a large park, where many people are doing picnics and having fun, they do not imagine that many ants are preparing to the winter. In this game, people will play different anthills creating paths and lanes around food, trying to create the most efficient way to gather resources for a strong winter. However, in their way, they may encounter other ants or even bigger bugs that could serve as a threaten to their plans. 
In each round, players will be able to improve they anthill to be able to gather and stock more food, build paths around the resources to prevent other anthills to compete for that food and fight against enemy bugs to protect their lives.

Name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2019
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Quiz of the year 2019'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about quiz of the year 2019. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

—user summary

Name: Box Quiz: Årsquiz 2018
Description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Quiz of the year 2018'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about quiz of the year 2018. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

—user summary

Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Adventures: Stan Sakai Box
Description:
Usagi Yojimbo meets TMNT featuring Stan Sakai’s iconic hero and his take on the TMNT in this Kickstarter Exclusive pack.

Includes: Miyamoto Usagi miniature, 3 Usagi dice, 5 hero cards, Usasgi ability cards, alt-sculpt TMNT miniatures, and 1 rulesheet.

Name: Funkoverse Strategy Game: Aggretsuko 100
Description:
In the Funkoverse Strategy Game, you combine your favorite characters and go head-to-head in four exciting game scenarios. Use your characters' unique abilities to gain points and achieve victory!

Each turn, you select one of your characters and perform two actions. Each character has access to basic actions like moving and challenges as well as several unique abilities that may be performed only by spending ability tokens. Funkoverse uses an innovative "cooldown" system — the more powerful the ability, the longer it will take for the ability token to become available again — so players have to spend their ability tokens wisely. Each character in Funkoverse is unique, so players are encouraged to try out different combinations of characters and items in order to discover their favorite synergies and powerful strategies for all four game scenarios.

Funkoverse Strategy Game: Aggretsuko is an expansion for any standalone title in the Funkoverse line-up that features the title character from the animated show of the same name.

Name: Imperial Settlers: Rise of the Empire
Description:
Rise of the Empire is a meta-expansion that adds a completely new layer to Imperial Settlers by introducing an open-world campaign setting. From game to game, players' empires will advance, reaching new eras, goals, technologies, discoveries, and provinces. (You don't need to play the campaign in a set group of co-players as each empire can develop at its own pace and represent different stages of advancement.)

This meta-expansion includes 220 new cards divided into three types: Provinces, Goals & Achievements, and Technologies & Discoveries. In addition Imperial Settlers: Rise of the Empire shortens gameplay from five to four rounds.

—description from the publisher

Name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Loner Raph Pack
Description: A Kickstarter Exclusive addition for TMNT City Fall and Change is Constant. The pack includes: 3 dice, a hero sheet, an initiative card, and 1 miniature.
Families: Comic Books: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
